hint.text:
Represent the number as a product of its prime factors.
Remember, in the prime factorisation of a cube number, each factor appears thrice.

solution.text:
\(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**2)}}_\)
\(=_{{str(j) + ('\\times' + str(j))*(m-1)}}_ \times _{{str(k) + ('\\times' + str(k))*(n-1)}}_ \times _{l}_ \times _{l}_ \)
\(\)
Notice that the factors \(_{j}_\) and \(_{k}_\) appear in groups of three.
\(_{l}_\) is the only factor that exists in a pair.
Therefore, \(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**2)}}_\) must be multiplied by \(_{l}_\) so as to get a perfect cube.

content.text: Find the smallest number by which \(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**2)}}_\) must be  multiplied so as to get a perfect cube?
